message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about text summarization, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) domain of computer science. The paper specifically focuses on abstractive summarization, which involves generating a summary that is not simply a copy of sentences from the input document, but rather a new summary that captures the main ideas of the document. This task is relevant to several sub-categories of arXiv CS, including:

- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category covers research on NLP, including text summarization.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category covers research on machine learning and other AI techniques, which are often used in text summarization.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category covers research on various machine learning techniques, which are often used in text summarization.
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): This sub-category covers research on techniques for retrieving relevant information from large collections of documents, which is related to the task of summarization.
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): This sub-category covers research on neural networks and other computational models inspired by biology, which are often used in text summarization.
